clinical_study.brief_title: The Development and Initial Evaluation of a Web-based, Compassion-focussed Course for New Mothers
clinical_study.official_title: The Development and Initial Evaluation of a Web-based, Compassion-focussed Course for New Mothers

brief_summary.textblock: This study examines the relationship between self-compassion and wellbeing in new mothers and whether an online self-help course for new mothers can help to improve their wellbeing and self-compassion.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a randomised controlled trial (RCT) comparing an online self-help course ('Kindness for Mums') with a wait-list control. A battery of self-report measures will be administered online at baseline (week 0), post-intervention (week 6) and at follow-up (week 12). Baseline data will also be used to examine the relationship between self-compassion and wellbeing.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 6-weeks on the Warwick-Edinburgh Mental Well-Being Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline at 6-weeks on the Self-Compassion Scale
Change from baseline at 6-weeks on the Forms of Self-Criticising/Attacking and Self-Reassuring Scale
Change from baseline at 6-weeks on the Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale 21-item version
Change from baseline at 12-weeks on the Warwick-Edinburgh Mental Well-Being Scale
Change from baseline at 12-weeks on the Self-Compassion Scale
Change from baseline at 12-weeks on the Forms of Self-Criticising/Attacking and Self-Reassuring Scale
Change from baseline at 12-weeks on the Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale 21-item version

arm_group.description: An online self-help course designed to promote self-kindness and self-compassion in new mothers
A waiting list control group, who will receive access to the online self-help intervention once the RCT is complete.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- New mothers (can be biological, adoptive or full-time foster mother)
- Able to complete baseline measures when infant aged 0-12 months
- Fluent in English
- Live in the United Kingdom
- Able to access the internet
Exclusion Criteria:
- Experiencing suicidal ideation at the time of enrolment
